title: Gourds
text: In Chinese popular culture, there has long been a convention of using plants or animals to embody certain propitious meanings. The image of melons-gourds in this case-connected one to another by vines, suggests generations of sons and grandsons stretching on without interruption. The pun comes from the word <I>dai<I> (belt)-the vine-linked melons-that provides a homophone on the word <I>dai<I> (generations).
description: thick brown vines and dark green-grey leaves; four yellow, green and brown gourds growing on vines; text, LLC
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
